Title: My Winter Hat
Author: by Julia Durango
Content: “Don't forget your hat!” Mom called,
as I ran out to play.
(She says the same old silly thing
each nippy, wintry day.)
But when I put my hat on,
it makes my poor head swelter.
And when I take it off, you see,
my hair goes helter-skelter.¹
In snowball fights I always lose
because my hat's so bright.
A sitting duck is what I am,
a blaze amidst the white.
“Oh, Mom, my hat is itchy,
and it catches on my ear!
Sometimes it falls below my eyes—
it's much too large, I fear.”
Then Mom said, “Don't you worry, dear,
I have a grand surprise.
Grandma's sent a brand-new hat,
and look, it's just your size!”
